Where the finest fish of Jeju meet master craftsmanship and exquisite, hand-picked ingredients such as vinegar, soy sauce and miso prepared by master artisans in Japan, Sushi Hoshikai offers not only traditional sushi but also the magnificent, heavenly flavors of fish found only in the oceans of Jeju. Sushi Hoshikai welcomes you to experience a timeless and moving taste, lingering in both the body and mind, as we lead your senses through a special gastronomic journey.

Finding an ideal hotel in Jeju does not have to be difficult. Welcome to Hotel With Jeju, a nice option for travelers like you.

name: Landing Jeju Shinhwa World Hotels & Resorts
description: Embrace upscale hotel service at affordable prices. Whether you’re here on vacation or for a business conference with some sightseeing thrown in, Landing’s 615 sophisticated guest rooms offer the perfect balance of comfort, with Simmons premium beds and centralized smart lighting and climate controls, and down-to-earth prices. Landing Deli offers a selection of irresistibly cute desserts, while international buffet restaurant Landing Dining draws on culinary styles and aromas from around the world while offering outstanding value. Works by Jeju artists are displayed throughout the hotel and its grounds in homage to the island’s vibrant culture, while Landing Convention Center has won wide acclaim for its successful hosting of major events including the SBS Supermodel Contest and the reception banquet for The CJ Cup @ Nine Bridges, Korea’s first PGA Tour.

name: Jeju Goldone Hotel & Suites
description: Chic Boutique Hotel in Jeju Island, South Korea. Located in the most beautiful hills in Jeju Island, overlooking the azure South Sea, this elegant and luxurious hotel features 51 sophisticated and spacious suites and rooms across 5 storeys. A delightful heated swimming pool, spa jacuzzi overlooking the ocean from your own room, a seafood and vegetarian food destination, a rooftop garden with panoramic views from Seogwipo Provincial Marine Park to the sacred Mount Halla are a few features to indulge at GoldOne. Located in Olle 7-gil nature trail, arguably the best Olle trail in Jeju, open air balconies in your own room will add a treat for your senses and extra privilege. GoldOne Hotel & Suites is dedicated to couples, families, friends, groups, leaders in style and global entrepreneurs who will experience an opportunity to discover the breath-taking nature of Jeju Island. Truly an idyllic and adventurous getaway place.

Modeled after a deluxe cruise ship in Northern Europe, this floating hotel is located within 10 minutes' ride from both Jeju harbor and Jeju International Airport. It can be reached within an hour wherever you are on the Jeju Island. Visitors from home and abroad can experience the essence of Jeju culture enjoying the nearby spectacles of Chilsung-Ro street, Tap-dong outdoor performance hall, Sanjicheon, Yongduam, and Yongyeon bridge especially during the night time. Ramada is the first floating hotel in Korea, whose guest rooms make its guests have a unique experience of feeling as if they were on the sea. description: 해비치 호텔 & 리조트 - - 24년 5월 말에 유니크한 스위트 객실을 신설했습니다. 또한, 게더링 공간 확대, 사계절 야외 온수풀 운영, 신규 레스토랑 운영 및 라운지 서비스를 제공합니다. 제주 민속촌 바로 옆에 자리한 해비치 호텔 & 리조트는 근처에는 표선 해비치 해변도 있습니다. 차로 1시간이면 성산 일출봉까지 가실 수 있습니다. 제주국제공항까지는 차로 1시간이 소요됩니다.야외 수영장은 실내로도 연결되며, 유아풀과 자쿠지도 갖추었습니다. 이외에 스파, 사우나, 피트니스센터, 테니스코트, 보드게임존, 키즈 전용 놀이 공간과 엔터테인먼트 존 등 즐길 거리와 편의점, 소품샵 등 볼거리도 많습니다. 주차장에는 급속 3대와 완속 6대의 전기차 충전기를 보유하고 있습니다. 288실의 호텔 객실과 215실의 리조트 객실을 포함한 503의 객실을 보유하며, 최소 객실 면적이 47평방미터로 국내에서 가장 넓은 공간을 자랑합니다. 호텔과 리조트형으로 나뉘어 있으며 내부에는 에어컨, Tv, 냉장고, 전기 주전자가 있으며 욕실에는 비데와 욕실용품, 헤어드라이어 등이 구비되어 있습니다. 별도로, 리조트형에는 주방이 마련되어 있습니다. 호텔동과 리조트동 두 건물에 프렌치, 한식뿐 아니라 뷔페식으로 제공되는 레스토랑이 있으며, 실내외에 운치 있는 바, 신선한 음료와 베이커리를 제공하는 베이커리 샵 마고 등 다양한 먹거리가 있습니다.

description: 서귀포 1청사 남단, 웅장한 외관을 자랑하는 호텔골든데이지 서귀포오션은 고객님들의 편안한 휴식을 위해 최고의 시설, 품격있는 서비스를 제공해 드리고 있습니다. 지하 2층에서 지상 13층으로 이어지는 호텔 내의 281개의 객실, 따뜻한 느낌의 고급스러운 인테리어와 다채로운 요리가 가득한 레스토랑은 호텔을 찾아주시는 모든 분들의 오감을 만족시키기에 부족함이 없을 것입니다. 호텔골든데이지 서귀포오션만이 가진 품격 있는 서비스와 함께 정방폭포, 천지연폭포, 서귀포 올레시장 등의 다양한 제주 문화 레져를 함께 즐겨보시기 바랍니다.

name: Booyoung Jeju Hotel & Resort
description:
See why so many travelers make Booyoung Jeju Hotel & Resort their hotel of choice when visiting Seogwipo. Providing an ideal mix of value, comfort and convenience, it offers a trendy setting with an array of amenities designed for travelers like you.
The rooms offer air conditioning, and getting online is possible, as free wifi is available, allowing you to rest and refresh with ease.
Booyoung Jeju Hotel & Resort features room service. In addition, as a valued Booyoung Jeju Hotel & Resort guest, you can enjoy a pool and an on-site restaurant that are available on-site. Guests arriving by vehicle have access to free parking.
While staying at Booyoung Jeju Hotel & Resort, visitors can check out Yakchunsa Temple (1.6 mi), which is a popular Seogwipo attraction.
If you are looking for some good spots to eat nearby, you may want to check out Soul Kitchen (0.9 mi), Starbucks Jeju Jungmun (0.9 mi), or Vadada (0.9 mi), all of which are within walking distance of Booyoung Jeju Hotel & Resort.
If you’re looking for something to do, Daepo Haean Jusangjeolli Cliff (0.4 mi), Cheonjeyeon Falls (0.8 mi), and Yeomiji Botanical Garden (0.9 mi) are a nice way to spend some time, and they are all within walking distance of Booyoung Jeju Hotel & Resort.
We’re sure you’ll enjoy your stay at Booyoung Jeju Hotel & Resort as you experience all of the things Seogwipo has to offer.

name: Grand Josun Jeju
description: Embark on a special journey at Grand Josun Jeju newly introduced by Josun hotels & Resorts for a good rest away from city. Located inside the Jungmun Tourist Complex and 50 minutes away from Jeju International Airport, Grand Josun Jeju is a five-star luxurious resort hotel brought to you by Josun hotels & Resorts with its 100-year-long expertise in the reinterpretation of classical elegance and modern designs. Total 248 rooms faced towards the clear emerald waters and immersed in the vitality of nature let guests enjoy time away from their ordinary lives. There are restaurants, all-season pool, spa, and kids club available at all times.

name: Hidden Cliff Hotel & Nature
description:
If you’re looking for a luxury hotel in Seogwipo, look no further than Hidden Cliff Hotel & Nature.
Close to some of Seogwipo's most popular landmarks, such as Daepo Haean Jusangjeolli Cliff (1.8 mi) and Yakchunsa Temple (2.8 mi), Hidden Cliff Hotel & Nature is a great destination for tourists.
Hidden Cliff Hotel & Nature offers guests an array of room amenities including air conditioning, a minibar, and a refrigerator, and getting online is possible, as free wifi is available.
The hotel offers room service and a concierge, to make your visit even more pleasant. The property also features a pool and breakfast. Guests arriving by vehicle have access to free parking.
When you're feeling hungry, you can check out Soul Kitchen (1.0 mi), Starbucks Jeju Jungmun (0.7 mi), or Childonga (1.0 mi), which are all within walking distance of Hidden Cliff Hotel & Nature.
Seogwipo is also home to Davinci Museum, a popular science museum that is not too far from Hidden Cliff Hotel & Nature.
The staff at Hidden Cliff Hotel & Nature looks forward to serving you during your upcoming visit.

name: Jeju Kimnyoung Maze Park
description: Gimnyeong Maze Park (김녕미로공원) is located between the two major tourist destinations of Manjanggul Cave and Gimnyeongsagul Cave. It was designed by the world famous company Adrian Fisher Minotaur Maze Designs and funded by the life-time savings of an American Professor at Cheju National University, Frederic H. Dustin, whose love for Jeju has kept him on the island for 27 years. This unique maze park contains foliages from all over Asia and has been personally maintained by Dr Dunstan since 1987. Gimnyeong Maze Park contains a maze that has seven images incorporated in it. The maze is in the shape of the Jeju Island, and its images that can be clearly seen from above include the following: a serpent, which was an object of worship on the island until the mid-70s; native horses of Jeju Island, which were brought there by Mongolians as far back as 1276; the ship, the Sparrowhawk, that was shipwrecked on the island in 1653 bringing Hendrick Hamel and his company of Dutch sailors to the Joseon Kingdom; and dolmens that are relics from the Bronze Age. All of these images are famous symbols or landmarks of Jeju Island. There are three skywalks called ‘gureum dari’ and an observatory, which are popular photo sites for tourists. They offer panoramic views of the entire maze. There are four ways to get through the maze from the entrance. If you use a map, it will take only 5 minutes, but without a map it’s a bit more difficult and can take up to 20 minutes. Some visitors have been known to spend up to 50 minutes lost in the maze before giving up and calling for help!

name: Teddy Bear Museum Jeju
description: Welcome to the first Teddy Bear Museum in Korea. Here you will find everything you want to know about Teddy Bears. Teddy Bears have been loved and cherished since they were first introduced over 100 years ago. There are now millions of people who collect Teddy Bears. They seek out old, unique and valuable teddy bears for their personal collections. Our Teddy Bear Museum opened especially for the European collectors. The Teddy Bear Museum is more exciting than ever with "Teddy Bear" entertainment as never seen before. Jeju Teddy Bear Museum opened on April 24, 2001. It contains two galleries, a museum gift shop, and a museum cafe. Also, on site is a museum bar/restaurant, a wonderful place to meet friends, family, and lovers. From the outside garden, there is a view of Jung-Mun Beach.

description: 호텔휘슬락에 오신 것을 환영합니다! 여러분의 "제 2의 집"인 제주 호텔에서는 여러분의 시간이 집처럼 편안하도록 다양한 부대시설을 제공합니다. 근처에 위치한 제주의 인기 명소인 관덕정(0.7 Km) 덕분에 이 곳 방문에 관심있는 분들에게는 호텔휘슬락(을)를 추천드립니다. 에어컨(이)가 완벽한 방에서의 시간을 즐기시고, 투숙객에게 무료 무선 인터넷을 제공하는 호텔휘슬락에서 인터넷을 마음껏 무료로 이용하실 수 있습니다. 호텔(은)는 24시 프론트 데스크, 선 테라스, 신문(을)를 제공합니다. 게다가 호텔휘슬락(은)는 바쁜 하루 중 쉬어갈 수 있는 수영장, 음식점도 제공합니다. 차를 가지고 오시는 투숙객들은 무료 주차도 가능합니다. 맛있는 아시아 요리(을)를 찾는다면 호텔휘슬락에서 묵는 동안 올래국수, 화로향 또는 자매국수(을)를 꼭 가보시기 바랍니다. 무엇보다도 호텔휘슬락에서 지내면 지척에 있는 흑돼지 거리(0.2 Km), 용두암(1.5 Km), 제주 민속자연사 박물관(1.3 Km)(와)과 같은 제주 관광명소를 쉽게 만나보실 수 있습니다. 호텔휘슬락(은)는 제주의 최고만을 엄선, 선별하여 쉽게 즐길 수 있기 때문에 여러분의 시간이 한결 여유롭고 즐거울 것입니다.

name: Hallim Park
description: Jeju Hallim Park is a field of frontier spirit of a man who transformed a wasteland to a green paradise. Consisting nine different theme gardens and seasonal festivals, Hallim park is an international tourist attraction of Jeju island, South Korea exhibiting global species of plants and animals. It is 80 acre big and has nearly 1.2 million visitors every year. Visitor can also enjoy Jeju's traditional cuisine in our restaurants. (Gardens) 1. Subtropical botanic garden 2. Palm tree avenue 3. Wild grass and flower garden 4. Hyeopjae and Ssangyong cave 5. Jeju stone and bonsai garden 6. Jae-am folk village 7. Bird garden 8. Jeju stone exhibit hall 9. Water garden (Seasonal Festivals) Jan. - Daffodil Feb. - Ume flower Mar. - Tulip Apr. - Cherry blossoms May - Wild flower Jun. - Hydrangea Jul. thru Sep. - Water lily and lotus Oct. - Pumpkin Nov. - Chrysanthemum Dec. - Camelia (Restaurants and Cafe) - Palm tree restaurant - Dolharubang restaurant - Herb cafe

name: Spirited Garden
description: In 1968, Director Sung set on his project to turn a piece of deserted 'wasteland' at Jeoji-ri, Hanyoung-myon into something else. Thanks to his strenuous efforts and strong will, we now have the beautiful garden that represents the quintessence of Jeju. Consisting of 7 small gardens and auxiliary facilities, this Spirited Garden provides spaces where you can find peace of mind surrounded by waterfall, ponds, stone bridges as well as trees. All the garden trees, bunjaes, and stones allows you to relieve yourself from any everyday life burden and to take a respite to enjoy the beauty of the nature. High walls built in order to protect trees from strong winds became castles and the architectures built to house exhibitions and to serve convenience purposes now represent the beauty of the nature in Jeju. They are sure to provide people from around the world with chances to think of a new paradigm of life

description: At La Scala, we endeavor to blend Jeju's fresh ingredients with a contemporary culinary approach, providing an unforgettable dining experience. For breakfast, savour a blend of Korean and Western, hot and cold dishes including beef steak, homemade Jeju carrot jam, homemade black garlic butter! During the day and dinner, we offer a variety of Jeju specialities including Boiling Lobster platter (2 per), Black pork BBQ platter (2 per), Korean chicken with our kitchen's secret batter, Squid ink Double cheese burger, Seafood pomodoro spaghetti, pizzas, and many more! Please let us know if you have any food restrictions. We cater for vegetarian, pescatarian, vegan and Halal.

name: Hotel Kenny Story Jeju
description:
Looking for a place to stay in Jeju? Then look no further than Ramada Encore by Wyndham Jeju Yeondong, a family-friendly hotel that brings the best of Jeju to your doorstep.
Ramada Encore by Wyndham Jeju Yeondong is a family-friendly hotel offering air conditioning, a refrigerator, and a desk in the rooms, and it is easy to stay connected during your stay as free wifi is offered to guests.
The hotel features a 24 hour front desk, room service, and a concierge. Plus, guests can enjoy a fitness center and breakfast, which have made this a popular choice among travelers visiting Jeju. For guests with a vehicle, free parking is available.
While staying at Ramada Encore by Wyndham Jeju Yeondong, visitors can check out Yongduam Rock (2.0 mi) and Gwandeokjeong Pavilion (2.3 mi), some of Jeju's top attractions.
While you’re here, be sure to check out some of the Asian restaurants, including Donsadon, Ollae Guksu, and Jamae Guksu, all of which are a short distance from Ramada Encore by Wyndham Jeju Yeondong.
If you are interested in exploring Jeju, check out one of the historic sites, such as Jejumok Gwana, Samseonghyeol, and Hangpaduri Hangmong.
We’re sure you’ll enjoy your stay at Ramada Encore by Wyndham Jeju Yeondong as you experience everything Jeju has to offer.
hotelClassAttribution: This property is classified according to Giata.

name: December Hotel Jeju
description:
December Hotel Jeju is an excellent choice for travelers visiting Jeju, offering a family-friendly environment alongside many helpful amenities designed to enhance your stay.
While staying at December Hotel Jeju, visitors can check out Yongduam Rock (2.2 mi) and Gwandeokjeong Pavilion (2.4 mi), some of Jeju's top attractions.
Guest rooms offer a flat screen TV and air conditioning, and December Hotel Jeju makes getting online easy as free wifi is available.
You can also take advantage of some of the amenities offered by the hotel, including a 24 hour front desk, room service, and baggage storage. As an added convenience, there is free parking available to guests.
While you’re here, be sure to check out some of the seafood restaurants, including Samsunghyeol Haemultang, Sushi Hoshikai, and Gozipfish, all of which are a short distance from December Hotel Jeju.
Enjoy your stay in Jeju!

name: Somerset Jeju Shinhwa World
description: Experience the essence of rural Jeju in the leafy surroundings of the island’s unique gotjawal forest. Unwind with your family in a generous 154m2 suite with three bedrooms, two bathrooms and a fully-equipped kitchen. Put your feet up and leave the housework to a host of premium smart appliances including wine cellar, dishwasher, oven, jumbo-sized fridge, washing machine and dryer. In addition, display of 4 large scale paintings by German Neo-expressionist Sigmar Polke will also contribute to create an overwhelming ambiance at the museum.

name: Noodle Bbopneun Teacher Man du Bit Neun Anae
Steak House (grand Hyatt Jeju)
description: Incredible food and awe-inspiring Jeju panoramas views make for the match at the Steak House. The best beef cuts, alongside a curated menu of market-fresh seafood, are grilled to perfection. Pair our house butcher's finest cuts with a selection of fine wines and spirits, leaving room for the range of tempting desserts, the venue for any celebrations.

name: Noknamu (grand Hyatt Jeju)
description: Welcome to the thrill of the grill at Noknamu, where our premium Korean Hanwoo beef and Jeju black pork takes center stage. Turn up the heat Jeju-style and watch as the finest cuts of marbled meat are charcoal grilled to perfection at your table, while traditional banchan sides and local artisanal gosorisul and makgeolli liquors complete this truly show-stopping culinary experience.

name: Jeju Hot Pot (grand Hyatt Jeju)
description: A Chinese hot pot restaurant, localized to feature local Jeju meat, seafood and seasonal vegetables. You can choose from traditional Chinese soup bases for an authentic and interactive dining experience – prepared expertly by our resident master soup chef. The entrance of the restaurant is designed to replicate the buzz of a local Jeju seasonal market, with vibrant displays of live seafood, marbled meats and farm fresh vegetables.

name: Harbor Hotel
description: Located in the Jeju City district in Jeju, only 300m away from Jeju International Ferry Terminal, 5.07km away from Jeju International Airport-just a 15-minute drive. You can also hop on the Jeju interciy Bus near the hotel. Harbor Hotel features free WiFi throughout the property and you will find a 24-hour front desk. All guest rooms at this hotel are air conditioned and are equipped with a flat-screen TV with cable and satellite channels, refrigerator, a hairdryer and an electric kettle. Complimentary mineral water is available in the room. Certain rooms have views of the sea or city. Rooms are equipped with a private bathroom fitted with a shower. For your comfort, you will find slippers and free toiletries. You will find a 24-hour front desk at the property. The biggest traditional open market called Dong-mun is 1.4 km away from Harbor Hotel, while Samyang Black Sand Beach is 5 km away. Also, just right across from the hotel, you can enjoy the beauty of Sarabong Peak. The view of Jeju city and the harbor is great from the top of it and it’s well know for the sun set. Jeju City is a great choice for travellers interested in friendly locals, mountains and sightseeing.

name: Jeju Beer
description: Hello. This is Jeju Beer brewry that is local brewery of Jeju island in South Korea. This brewery is sister-brewery with Brooklyn brewery in New York. We provide tour program on friday, saturday, sunday.

name: Wonder Island
description: This is a new experiential media exhibition hall introduced by Magic Flow, the first media-based story park in Korea, at Jeju Shinhwa World. Meet the wonderful nature and animal friends of the imaginary island of Jeju, Jeju, at a total of 12 theme halls from the 1st to 3rd floors of the Somerset Clubhouse in Shinhwa World. Catch animals in the media, complete an animal guide, play drums, and even have a ball party! Children and teenagers will learn about Jeju through various experiences that stimulate their five senses.

name: Marine Park
description: The only one of dolphin experiential theme park in Korea.Enjoy the nature’s present at Marine Park. We are trying for people to feel what is the nature’s present through communion with dolphins. We hope you to experience our programs beyond your imagination. -Programs1.Dolphin Training Experience 2.Dolphin swimming & Snorkeling3.Dolphin Diving4.Dolphin Prenatal Training Project

name: Shinhwa Water Park
description: Enter an oasis of watery fun, where 18 wave pools, rapids, spas and slides come together with six restaurants and a Korean-style jjimjilbang sauna to create Jeju’s biggest indoor and outdoor water park. With baby nursing rooms, kids’ pools, Asia’s first double water slide, private cabanas, a variety of sauna rooms, hot snacks and fresh beer, there’s something here for everyone in the family

name: Figure Museum Jeju
description: We invite you to 'Figure Museum Jeju', full of fantastic movie figures and statues! There are tons of high quality exhibits! Action figures, movie statues, life size statues, upcycling arts, game statues, etc. Everybody can enjoy and have fun here with figures from movies and games and animations.

name: Arepa Grill
description: Typical Venezuelan Food, made of pre-cooked gluten free corn, stuffed with either chicken, beef, pork, egg, cheese, ham, sea food, etc. We also have Peruvian Seviche and Beef Carpaccio

name: C'cafe
description: The upscale buffet restaurant C'cafe, located on the top 22nd floor, serves a feast of local delicacies, including Jeju Bodeulgyeol beef, black pork and seafood, for the ultimate dining experience. C'cafe also boasts a breath-taking view of the open sea, Mt. Halla and the city, adding to the refinement of the restaurant.

name: China House (grand Hyatt Jeju)
description: China House is a modern tribute to traditional Chinese dining, serving the best of China’s provincial cuisines focusing on Northern Chinese, Shanghainese and Sichuan specialties. Indulge in a generous selection of appetizers and signature dishes, authentically prepared by our specialty chefs. Colorful and elaborate counter food displays, open kitchens and lively dining make for a complete sensory dining experience to tantalize your five senses. A must-try is the signature Peking Duck, freshly roasted and then skillfully carved tableside.

name: Hibiki Island
description: Hello, Thank you for your visit! :-) Our restaurant , Hibiki Island is based on Japanese cuisine. We prepare all the food with care and try to let customers feel to enjoy our dishes. name: Temple stay Food
description: jeju temple vegan food [temple stay food] Korean temple cusine refers to a type of cusine that originated in Buddhist temple of Korea. *Osinchae - The five strong herbs prohibited in Korean Buddhist temple include garlic, spring onions and etc. The reason these are prohibited is that they are pungent and strongly-flavored and as such might distract practitioners from their mental discipline. *No meat *No fish *No milk *No egg *No artificial flavor enhancer, MSG (monosodium glutamate) *No Salted Seafood *Only temple vegan!!!

However, it can be noisy out alley because of the restaurants, and this hostel is not suitable for light sleepers. There are strict rules such as no smoking in the building, no shoes in the room, no cooking, no party, no pets, and no children for other guests. The guests should speak Korean, French, or English for communication. No car park is available, so please find somewhere else. The minimum stay is 2 nights.

name: Mercure Ambassador Jeju
description: Mercure Ambassador Jeju: Your Gateway to Authentic Island Experiences Welcome to Mercure Ambassador Jeju, where we offer travelers a truly local and authentic experience. Our locally inspired hotel serves as a portal to the unspoiled natural beauty of Jeju Island, located just 10 minutes away from the island's main tourist attractions, such as the stunning Jungmun Beach and the revered Sanbangsan Mountain with its historic temple, surrounded by a breathtaking coastal landscape. Our hotel is more than just a place to stay; it's a sanctuary for healing and entertainment. Beyond being home to South Korea's top golf course, each room at our hotel ensures you wake up to breathtaking views of Jeju Island. With 71 guest rooms, a delightful restaurant showcasing local cuisine, a cozy lobby lounge, and an inviting heated infinity pool open year-round, we cater to your every need. Reaching us is a breeze, as we're a mere 30-minute taxi ride from Jeju International Airport. You're also just a 10-minute drive away from key leisure destinations like Jungmun tourism complex and Sanbangsan Mountain. If you prefer public transportation, Bus No. 282 from Jeju City or Seogwipo City stops right at our hotel's front gate. Maxime BEYER, our dedicated hotel manager, and our friendly team are ready to make your stay with us truly special. We invite you to experience the natural wonders of Jeju Island at Mercure Ambassador Jeju. Your adventure begins here!

name: Ocean Grand Hotel Jeju
description: Hamdeok Beach , is full of the beautiful and mystical blessings of the Pacific Ocean .The hotel was renovated and reopened in 2003 as an independent Korean hotel with economic room rates.The hotel has 74 cozy, comfortable rooms and subsidiary facilities including a coffee shop, a Western/Korean-style restaurant, a bar and seminar rooms.Guests can create long-lasting memories while enjoying the dramatic scenery of the green ocean and viewing Hallasan Mountain , the mountain that changes color by the season. Located on the first floor overlooking the blue waters of the Pacific Ocean and clear, white sandy beaches, the coffee shop & western-style restaurant is the perfect place to enjoy breakfast and/or business meetings. Guests can enjoy different dishes each season and tea or traditional drinks in one space. The restaurant also serves gateaux and wine. It can be used to hold various events. The Business Center strives to assist guests with their business needs.(Internet, Copy Machine, Fax, Printer, etc.)The Seminar Room is sufficiently large to hold banquets for 100 people or wedding ceremonies for 350 people, and is equipped with advanced facilities for international conferences. The room can also be used for dinner meetings and dinner receptions. The bar seats 60 people and has a separate private room for individuals and groups. The beautiful females in Jeju provide the finest services, allowing guests to enjoy a special evening.

name: Lunafall
description: Napole is the world's largest night digital theme park with an area of ​​120,000 pyeong. Based on the story, 'Since ancient times, people made wishes on the moon, and the moon became heavy with wishes and fell on Jeju,' it provides immersive experience content enjoyed while walking down the street at night. Lunapol consists of a total of 9 experience zones decorated with realistic media technologies such as media art and holograms. The worldview is richly implemented, including 'Luna Village', which reproduces the Lunapol worldview, the moon people 'Lunarian', and the language used by the moon people, 'Lunarian', further increasing immersion. Lunapol Fantasy, a combination of Lunapol's unique world view, Jeju's clean nature, and top immersive media technology, is a natural protected area containing Gotjawal and includes unpaved forest paths, so be careful about some of the routes, so wear safe and comfortable shoes and clothes. I recommend you.

name: AnnasSoup Brunch Restaurant & Cafe
description: Welcome to AnnasSoup Restaurant and Cafe! We try our best to offer tasty and healthy meals with Jeju ingredients. We’ve got yummy lacto-vegetarian cream soups, stews, handmade German-style sausages,and beef hamburg steaks. Our sourdough bread with rich flavor is the perfect for any dishes. We’ve also got some amazing coffee, tea, and homemade drinks made with Jeju citrus. Our place is cozy and welcoming with beautiful plants all around. You can sit inside or out on the terrace, use our free WiFi, and park right out front. We’re in the heart of old Seogwipo city and close to the popular tourist hotspots like Olle Street Market, waterfalls, Seogwipo Harbour. At AnnasSoup, we’re all about supporting independent living of people with disabilities. Our rep Anna has hearing and developmental disabilities herself. We’ve got wheelchair accessible tables and we do our best to make everyone feel welcome. Come join us for a delicious meal and make some unforgettable memories.

name: 9.81 PARK
description: The world's 1st smart racing theme park, '9.81 Park,' is located between the Aewol Sea and Mount Halla. 9.81 park offers a futuristic indoor space, various activities, and exciting racing experiences allowing visitors to fully experience Jeju's natural beauty. Through 3 types of GR (Gravity Racer) developed with 9.81 Park proprietary technology, you can enjoy racing solely powered by gravity acceleration(9.81m/s²) on 4 different types of tracks and 10 courses, while also savoring the beauty of Jeju's nature. ‘Downhill Racing’ offers breathtaking views of the blue sea of Biyangdo Island, while ‘Uphill Racing’ takes you through an automatic return track after the race, providing an experience of the beautiful Halla Mountain view. The main activity here is gravity racing, but in addition to that, 9.81 park offers a diverse range of activities to entertain everyone! If you need more information, please check 9.81 Park official website. (https://www.981park.com/)

name: World Heritage Network - Hallasan National Park Adventure Tours
description: We specialize in arranging adventure day tour to trek and explore Mount Hallasan at Jeju Island, South Korea. Mount Hallasan is a shield volcano and is the highest mountain in South Korea. The area around the mountain is a designated national park, the Hallasan National Park and is commonly considered to be one of the three main mountains of South Korea, with Jirisan and Soeraksan being the other two. If you wish to join our Mount Hallasan Trail Trekking Day Tour at some of the famous trails, please email us.

name: Choi Hostel Jeju
description: By staying at Choi Hostel (also known as H.Y Choi Hostel) you’ll give yourself the perfect base to go out and embrace all that Jeju has to offer whether you're here on business or vacation. Located in a popular neighbourhood in the heart of Seogwipo city, you’re only a 5 minute walk from the famous Olle street market, restaurants and shopping area. Choi hostel marks the start of the Olle #7 Trail, with the charming Cheonjiyeon falls and beautiful Oedolgae rock also within walking distance. The hostel itself embraces more of a ‘hotel’ feel, providing comfort and convenience at exceptional value. Rooms are bigger than most city centre hotels and include a private bathroom, kitchenette, air-conditioning and under floor heating. Choi Hostel provides linens, towels and free toiletries, as well as complimentary bottled water and Wi-Fi in all rooms & common areas. Free car parking on-site and luggage storage is there to make you feel more at ease. Make yourself at home by using the fully equipped communal kitchen & restaurant. You’re free to bring in food & drink from outside, or cook up a storm yourself. Share travel stories & mingle with fellow guests in this international hotel on the newly refurbished rooftop with beautiful views of the city skyline.

name: Father's Garden
description: Father's Garden is an emotional healing theme park that is located in the Seogwipo district of Jeju Island, South Korea. The area has been cultivated as a landscaping farm since 1966. We opened as a garden style theme park in 2021 with the main purpose of providing our visitors a space to tap into their child-like innocence, wonder, and joy. Along with the hundreds of different species of trees and plants, there is a main flower festival held every season. In the springtime Canola flowers and Apricot flowers, during summer season Hydrangea flowers, in the autumn Pink Muhly and Pampas, and in the wintertime Camellia flowers. You can also pick tangerines beginning in the late autumn till the end of winter. There are various creative photospots spread throughout the whole park.

name: Alcatraz Island
description: Alcatraz Island was once the most secure federal prison in the U.S., and held notorious inmates like Al Capone. After being decommissioned in 1963, the prison is now a museum, welcoming millions of curious travelers every year. Catch the ferry on Pier 33 to Alcatraz and explore the island at your own pace as you soak up the views of San Francisco and the bay. You can take a guided tour with a park ranger to learn more about the intriguing anecdotes about the facility’s fascinating history. But book your spots early—tickets sell out fast. – Tripadvisor

name: Good Diver Jeju
description: Good Diver diving center will provide premium diving service in Jeju, Korea. We offer all PADI certified courses as well as specialty courses and fun diving.

name: Saona Island
description: While you can't stay overnight on Saona Island—it's part of a national park—it makes for a great day out in the Caribbean. It’s a two-hour catamaran trip on gentle Caribbean waters to the island with food, drinks, and dancing, or a 30-minute speedboat if you’re pressed for time. Visiting Saona Island is best done as part of a tour that includes snorkeling and a stop at the waist-deep Blue Lagoon, where you will be able to see starfish. There are tours for various budgets, and it’s best to book ahead online and read reviews to find a package that fits your needs. – Tripadvisor

name: Granville Island
description: This large sandbar and former industrial site is now a posh, artsy neighborhood filled with quaint shops, eateries, breweries, and year-round arts and cultural festivals. Located in False Creek, it's famous for the Granville Island Public Market where you can get fresh produce, gourmet food, and artisanal handicrafts. Visit during summer when the island is exceptionally bustling with outdoor entertainment acts, or during the holidays for twinkling festive lights. You can get to Granville Island by car by crossing the Granville Bridge. Otherwise, you can also take a scenic ferry ride, or a walking or bike tour of the waterfront. – Tripadvisor

name: Jeju Olle Kayak Tour
description: Located on the west side of the island, we offer guided tours with experienced and CPR certified guides. We have multiple trips depending on your adventure just contact us we would love to hit the waters! It is a one hour trip with training and open water kayaking. And after riding the seas check out Sonagi Cafe with organic herbs, local produce and our occasional drink specials.

name: All Blu
description: * AllBlu, a scuba diving center located in Seogwipo, Jeju Island. (since 2015~) * Experts who truly love scuba diving on Jeju Island will be able to enjoy it according to the course you want, such as experience/fun! * You can enjoy scuba diving with or without a license. * We will return your precious time in Jeju Island and memories from AllBlu.

name: Blue Lagoon Island
description: Enjoy a full-day excursion from Nassau to the idyllic Blue Lagoon Island, where you can swim with dolphins, interact with sea lions and stingrays, or even snorkel among native nurse sharks. There are plenty of other things to do here: join a Segway safari tour, swim in the lagoon, enjoy an eco adventure, or just simply savor some peace and quiet on an adults-only beach. A lunch buffet is usually included in your ticket, but lines can get quite long. Go all out with the Ultimate Animal Access pass, which includes roundtrip ferry transportation and lunch. – Tripadvisor

name: Aewol Bakery cafe
description: Aewol Bakery Cafe is a delightful bakery cafe situated in front of the stunning Aewol Sea in Jeju Island. This charming cafe has gained additional popularity due to a visit from BTS member Jimin. With its picturesque location overlooking the mesmerizing Jeju sea, Aewol Bakery Cafe offers a unique experience for visitors. Takes pride in its assortment of beautiful desserts inspired by Jeju's natural landmarks. Among the highlights are desserts shaped like Hallasan Mountain and Hinrabong Peak, both of which are iconic symbols of Jeju Island. These visually appealing treats not only please the eyes but also satisfy the taste buds. What sets Aewol Bakery Cafe apart is its commitment to quality and expertise in baking. The chief of the bakery department possesses an impressive 30 years of experience, ensuring that every bread, dessert, and drink served in the cafe is crafted with utmost care and skill.

Featuring hardwood flooring and modern furnishings, each home at amber house is fitted with a small kitchen and a balcony with sea or mountain views. En suite bathroom is fitted with a shower booth. Barbecue facilities are available for rental in outdoor areas. From the holiday home, Gwakji Beach is under 20 minutes' drive and Jeju International Airport is 40 minutes' drive away. Aewol is a great choice for travelers interested in mountain walks, waterfalls and beaches.

name: De Palm Island
description: De Palm Island offers an all-inclusive Caribbean experience. Here, you can enjoy unlimited food and free-flow drinks, visit the water park, take a salsa lesson, have a banana boat ride, and more. You can even upgrade your experience with a SNUBA adventure, which combines snorkeling and diving; or a Sea Trek, where you’ll walk among fishes in a diving helmet. To mingle with the resort's resident flamingos, opt for a private cabana or premium seating on the beach. For the adventurous, visit De Palm Island as part of a UTV off-road adventure. Alternatively, join a tour with return hotel transfers. – Tripadvisor

name: Vieques Island
description: This island off the east coast Puerto Rico is best known as the location of the Bioluminescent Mosquito Bay, where you can see a mystical blue glow on the shores at night—best viewed on a kayaking or boat tour. But Vieques Island offers more than just that. Here, you can see wild horses galloping on the beach, explore the unspoiled mangroves of Vieques National Wildlife Refuge, and relax and snorkel at secluded beaches like La Chiva. You can also explore the town of Vieques and historic landmarks that give you a glimpse into the island's history. There's limited transportation on the island so make sure you book a rental car beforehand. – Tripadvisor

name: Jeju Stay Biuda
description: JEJU STAY BIUDA is a new multi cultural space established by a art culture content planner, combining culture, art, travel and relaxation.It is a place to empty the overwhelming every day modern life and be charged with new energy created from the nature of Jeju Island.
hotelClassAttribution: This property is classified according to Giata.

name: Snoopy Island
description: Snoopy Island, because it resembles the cartoon dog lying on its back, is a small rocky island floating off the coast of Fujairah in Al Aqah. You can try to swim to the rock from the private hotel beach (for a fee), or the public beach side—though the latter may only be possible when the tide is low and waters are calm. You can book a snorkeling tour of Snoopy Island which may also include other water activities like kayaking, diving, and standup paddleboarding in Fujairah. – Tripadvisor

name: Lokrum Island
description: Lokrum Island, home to a botanical garden, salt lake, and Benedictine monastery dating back at least to 1023, is a great escape from the bustle of Dubrovnik. Travelers and locals alike visit this island for its idyllic walking paths, natural swimming pools, and colorful peacocks. It’s also popular among Game of Thrones fans as the filming location for Qarth. A perfect day trip, boats regularly leave from Dubrovnik's Old Town port and take just 15 minutes to get to Lokrum. An additional entrance fee is required on the island. Lokrum is busiest in the summer vacation months of July and August. – Tripadvisor

name: Han Collection
description: Discover cutting-edge K-Fashion, the first concept of its kind in South Korea. HAN Collection handpicks 200 of the country's most exciting talents across 14 Select Shops - including casual, contemporary, trendy and street styles for men and women, alongside shoes, bags, jewelry and accessories. Han Collection debuts at two iconic destinations: Jeju Dream Tower and Seoul's Gwanghwamun Building.

Also highly skilled PADI scuba diving instructor and professionals operate a dive shop Doona divers is located near very famous diving point, Seop Islet, Moon Islet, Beom Islet. They have a famous diving point. Doona divers near that islet is convenient to go diving. First of all, reliable instructors introduce the beautiful sea of the Jeju Island. We have instructors who can speak English.

name: Zamalek (Gezira Island)
description: This island is located in the Nile River between downtown Cairo and Giza, and is characterized by upscale hotels, restaurants and pleasant gardens.

name: Okaloosa Island
description: Crowds flock to the beautiful beaches on this narrow strip along Florida’s Emerald Coast for the world-class clear waters and white sugar sand. The western end of the Okaloosa has family-friendly beach parks with picnic areas and playgrounds, a boardwalk with restaurants and shops, and attractions like the Gulfarium Marine Adventure Park. The beaches on the eastern tip tend to be more secluded and less crowded, offering a peaceful escape. Visit in April and May for warm waters and comfortable weather or during fall when fewer crowds make for a quieter experience. Book accommodation well in advance if you plan to visit in the summer. – Tripadvisor

name: Rose Island
description: This gorgeous island in the Bahamas is known for its crystal-clear waters, pink sand, and nine resident swimming pigs. Enjoy a welcome drink, chill in a hammock, hit up the beach bar, splash around with the adorable pigs, kayak in the sea, and go snorkeling with turtles. Watch out though—there have been shark sightings in the area. The island is just 25 minutes from Nassau and is best visited on a tour or boat charter, which typically includes snorkeling and pig encounters. It's also a great and cheaper alternative to Big Major Cay’s Pig Island. – Tripadvisor

name: Pinel Island
description: Topless optional

name: Catalina Island
description: Bask under the Caribbean sun at Catalina Island, known for its gorgeous white sand beaches surrounded by tropical palm trees. The crystal-clear waters here are home to diverse marine life, making it a popular spot for snorkeling and diving—you’re bound to spot some tropical fish and even sea urchins if you’re lucky. You can’t stay overnight as the island is part of a nature reserve. Instead, pick a boat tour that will take you there, stopping along the way for snorkeling and sightseeing. Many island hopping tours often include Catalina as a stop, too. – Tripadvisor

name: Manking Jeju Pony
description: Making Jeju Pony doll @ seaside cafe in Jeju Hello. I am teaching English and managing quilting club at school. The work of making a small Jeju pony is carried out in a small cafe with a beautiful sea view on the beach which is run by my husband. With warm tea, we will share the story of the real life and culture of Jeju as well. This activity will be a peaceful, healthy break during your tired traveling. Will you join us?

name: Shell Island
description: Ride the shuttle from Panama City Beach to Shell Island, where you can stroll along miles of white and soft sand as you spot dolphins frolicking and pelicans fishing from afar. Alternatively, make the most of your trip to the island by renting a pontoon boat to tour the area at your own pace. Swim in teal-blue waters, and don’t miss the peaceful Saint Andrew Bay on the other side of the island. Pack food, water, sunscreen, and other necessary supplies, as there are no amenities available. Also, pack a beach umbrella, as there is nothing to shade you from the Florida sun. – Tripadvisor

name: Water Island
description: The fourth-largest of the U.S. Virgin Islands, this quiet 492-acre island beckons travelers in search of a laid-back vacation. At the pristine Honeymoon Beach, which is a short walk from the ferry dock, you can swim, snorkel, kayak or chill by the beach bar. You can also bike around the island to view birds and other wildlife that call this place home, or hike up to the historic fort and explore remains of military fortifications. To reach Water Island, you can take a boat tour or ride the ferry from St. Thomas. – Tripadvisor

name: Tortuga Island
description: Alcatraz and Tolinga—two tiny islands that make up Tortuga Island, off the Costa Rican coast—make for a perfect day trip in the Puntaneras region. Take a catamaran tour from Montezuma to spot dolphins frolicking in the ocean on your way to the islands. When you get there, you can snorkel with fish in the turquoise waters or relax on Isla Tortuga’s white-sand beaches. There are plenty of rum cocktails for grownups to sip on. More adventurous travelers can go kayaking or hiking through the jungle. Beat the crowds by getting there in the early morning. – Tripadvisor

name: EV Pass
description: EV Pass is a kickscooter (e-scooter) sharing and rental platform service company. We provide riding experiences in Jeju Island.

name: Monkey Island
description: Located in the middle of Lake Gatun, this island is a unique and fun-filled destination that lets you get up close and personal with monkeys. These curious creatures will come right up to your boat and even jump on board in hopes of a bite of fruit. Monkey Island can only be accessed through a tour (usually from Panama City), which can be combined with a visit to the sloth sanctuary or a rainforest walk. The best time to visit is during the dry season (December to April) when the weather is clear and the monkeys are the most active. – Tripadvisor

name: Kim Husband Jaecheop Hangover Cure Soup
Sinui Hanmo
description: 100% 국내산 콩으로 매일 다양한 두부와 두부요리를 만드는 일반메뉴와 비건메뉴가 있는 두부요리전문점 입니다. (GMO Free), 3무(유화제,방부재,소포재)등 일체의 첨가제를 넣지 않고 오직 제주의 깨끗한 물과 해양심층수(간수)로 만드는 건강한 두부입니다 We are a tofu specialty restaurant that offers both regular and vegan menus, preparing a variety of tofu and tofu dishes daily using 100% domestic soybeans (GMO-free). The tofu is made without any additives, including emulsifiers, preservatives, and anti-foam agents, using only clean water from Jeju and deep sea water (salted water), ensuring healthy tofu. "다양한 두부요리가 있으며, 현재 비건메뉴로는 1인비건세트 : 유부초밥3p+두부토핑+순두부(오보로두부)+아게다시도후(부드러운 두부튀김과 소스) 단품 : 오보로두부(순두부) 콩국수 아게다시도후(부드러운두부튀김과 소스) 모두부" "- We offer various tofu dishes, and currently, the vegan menu includes: - Vegan Set for One: 3 pieces of Inari Sushi (sushi rice in tofu skin) + Tofu Topping + Sundubu (soft tofu) + Agedashi Tofu (soft tofu tempura with sauce) - Single item: Sundubu (soft tofu), Kongguksu (cold soy milk noodle soup), Agedashi Tofu (soft tofu tempura with sauce), Mao Tofu"

You can use the specialty of the u-do of peanuts and make a peanut-jam burger, peanut ice cream. It also creates an amazing coffee using fresh beans. We are located in a reputable group manually and beautiful beaches in the udo - hagosu-dong.

name: Dilly
description: Come and enjoy the the best grilled sandwich in town! We serve perfectly crispy sandwiches and seasonal soups.

name: Gili Trawangan Island
description: Escape to the idyllic paradise of Gili Trawangan Island, where crystal-clear waters meet pristine sandy shores, and serenity beckons at every corner. Nestled in the heart of Indonesia's archipelago, this enchanting island offers a haven for those seeking a blissful retreat from the hustle and bustle of everyday life. Indulge in the ultimate island experience as you bask in the warm tropical sun and feel the gentle caress of the ocean breeze. Whether you're lounging on the powdery white beaches, snorkeling in the vibrant coral gardens, or exploring the charming village streets by bicycle, Gili Trawangan promises endless opportunities for relaxation and adventure. As the sun sets, immerse yourself in the vibrant island nightlife, where beachfront bars and restaurants come alive with live music and delicious cuisine. Savor the fresh flavors of local seafood dishes, sip on exotic cocktails, and dance the night away under the starry sky.

name: Madeline Island
description: Madeline Island is the largest island of the Apostle Islands, located in Lake Superior in Wisconsin. Forget the clock – you’re on island time! Stroll the sandy beaches and relax to the rhythm of waves rolling in. Watch and feel the breezes blowing through the towering pines. Immerse yourself in history. Savor beautifully prepared local fare, served up with a side of lakeshore views. Shop the galleries and cultivate your artistic spirit. Hike, bike, kayak, swim, canoe, golf, nap, read, shop, and dine. It’s all here for you on beautiful Madeline Island! Come over!

name: Coronado Island
description: Featuring miles of spacious beaches, a pretty main street, and a historic seafront resort, Coronado Island makes a pleasant day trip from San Diego. Walk along Orange Avenue to browse the boutiques and try great food, from cozy bistros to burger joints. Head off to the waterfront to explore the dunes and lounge on the soft sand of the island’s several beaches. For an exclusive experience, stay in the luxurious Hotel del Coronado, which has hosted presidents and royals. You can drive to Coronado Island through Coronado Bridge or take a 15-minute ferry ride from Broadway Pier in San Diego. – Tripadvisor

name: Memory In Jeju
description:
See why so many travelers make Memory In Jeju Pension their pension (b&b) of choice when visiting Seogwipo. Providing an ideal mix of value, comfort and convenience, it offers a romantic setting with an array of amenities designed for travelers like you.

Guest rooms offer a kitchenette and air conditioning, and Memory In Jeju Pension makes getting online easy as free wifi is available.
As an added convenience, there is free parking available to guests.
Travelers looking for a place to eat close to Memory In Jeju Pension can head to Tipsy Table (0.8 mi), Tamgung (1.1 mi), or Ari (0.7 mi), all of which are within walking distance.
Plus, during your trip, don't forget to check out an art gallery, such as Bonte Museum.
At Memory In Jeju Pension, your comfort and satisfaction come first, and they look forward to welcoming you to Seogwipo.

description:
Welcome to Luston Villa & Hotel, your Jeju “home away from home.” Luston Villa & Hotel aims to make your visit as relaxing and enjoyable as possible, which is why so many guests continue to come back year after year.
Luston Villa & Hotel is a family-friendly hotel offering air conditioning, a minibar, and a desk in the rooms, and it is easy to stay connected during your stay as free wifi is offered to guests.
The hotel features a 24 hour front desk, a concierge, and baggage storage. Plus, guests can enjoy a pool and an on-site restaurant, which have made this a popular choice among travelers visiting Jeju. For guests with a vehicle, parking is available.
If you are looking for a nearby place to eat, Luston Villa & Hotel is within walking distance of Aewollier (0.7 mi), a popular restaurant in the area.
If you’re looking for things to do, you can check out Halla Arboretum, which is a popular park amongst tourists.
Luston Villa & Hotel puts the best of Jeju at your fingertips, making your stay both relaxing and enjoyable.

name: Hotel Seogwipean
description: 호텔 서귀피안은 서귀포에서 머무시는 기간동안 편안한 공간을 제공하기위해 최선을 다하고 있습니다. 저희 서귀포 호텔 서귀피안에서만 느끼실 수 있는 보목동의 바다 전망과 제주도의 자연이 주는 편안함은 고객님께 행복한 추억으로 기억될것입니다. 2019년 7월에 오픈하여 제주도 서귀포시 보목동에 오션뷰 부띠끄 호텔을 목적으로 설립되었습니다. 6시 ~ 7시에는 노을이 고즈넉하게 깔리며, 객실 안에서도 노을 전망을 즐기실 수 있습니다. 객실 배정 순서는 예약 순서에 따라서 고층으로 우선 배정이 되오며 끝호수부터 배정됩니다. 또한, 고객님께서 하시는 지정 객실 배정 요청은 당일 호텔 상황에 따라서 여부가 변동될 수 있습니다. -(주)비앤리월드-

name: Jeju Black Pork World Sura Gan
The Dull Ice Flower
description: The Dull Ice Flower is an atmospheric cafe serving a variety of food and drink, with an open terrace directly facing the beautiful Sehwa Beach. The hamburger is made in-house with house-ground Angus beef, and the kitchen also serves a juicy slab of pan-seared pork belly, the most popular cut of meat in S Korea. The drink menu varies from coffee to a wide array of bottled and tap beer.

name: Coffine Gurunaru Aewol Handam Coastal Walking Path
Peanut Island Park
description: This 80-acre tropical park is a favorite among boaters and those looking for a range of recreational activities. You can kayak, fish and snorkel in the clear waters of the surrounding Lake Worth Lagoon or simply enjoy a lazy beach day and picnic on one of the island’s guarded and unguarded swimming spots. If you’re looking to stay overnight, the park has 17 campsites, but make your reservation well in advance as they’re very popular. While admission is free, you’ll have to pay for the water taxi from Palm Beach to reach the island. – Tripadvisor

name: Princes' Islands
description: This Turkish archipelago used to be the holiday destination of choice for the rich and famous. And with stunning Greek Orthodox monasteries, wooden houses, beautiful unspoiled forests, and gorgeous beaches—it's hard not to see why. Princes' Islands, or Adalar, is made up of nine small, mostly car-free, islands and is known for its horse-drawn carriages, reminiscent of a time gone by. Only four of the nine islands are inhabited, with Buyukada and Heybeliada being the largest. Decide for yourself which ones you want to visit, or book a boat tour from the Istanbul mainland that will take you to some of the best sights. – Tripadvisor

name: Al Noor Island
description: Lagoon island featuring a butterfly house, modern art installation, a cafe & a playground in the heart of Sharjah City.

name: Balboa Island
description: This charming man-made island has been around for over a century and is filled with cozy homes and mouth-watering eateries. Here, you can enjoy a scenic walk along the waterfront, explore the adjacent Collins Island, check out the small Balboa Island Museum, or rent a bike to explore the peaceful streets. When it's time for lunch, head over to Marine Avenue where you'll find family-owned taverns, Swiss bistros, and classic diners. Make sure to stop by the taffy store for some sweet treats, too. Visit during the holiday season to see homeowners decorate their homes in sparkling festive lights. If you're keen on dolphin and whale-watching, many boat tours depart from Balboa Island. – Tripadvisor

name: Flowerpot Island
description: A trip out to Flowerpot Island is a great way to experience Fathom Five National Marine Park. Private tour Boats leaving from Tobermory take visitors over shipwrecks and offer opportunities to see some of the islands in the park. Once you arrive at Flowerpot Island, visitors are treated to crystal clear waters, the Lighthouse Museum, trails, and of course the unique geology of the islands which includes caves and the famous Flowerpots. While you're on the island, remember: - Carry out all your garbage - Pack water and snacks - Don't climb the Flowerpots and remain on the designated trails - Take only pictures leave only footprints

name: Madh Island
description: This is a retreat destination just at the outskirts of Mumbai. The beach and the Versova fort located here are very popular. Madh Island can easily be reached by road or even by a ferry from Versova, Andheri.

name: Daydream Island Resort
description:
Daydream Island Resort, positioned within the Whitsundays and accessed from the Port of Airlie or Great Barrier Reef Airport, is Ecotourism certified and features 280 recently renovated guest rooms and suites.

Experience the underwater world with our Living Reef - a 200 metre coral lagoon and underwater observatory - home to 100+ species of marine life.

Offering guests multiple pools, a choice of restaurants and bars, an extensive range of activities and water sports, Kids Club together with a Day Spa featuring locally sourced Waterlily products. 

Our unique meetings and events spaces cater from six for dinner - up to 500 for cocktails.

name: Mount Desert Island
description: Home to Acadia National Park, this island off the coast of Maine with its beaches, sweeping cliffs and mountains offers visitors numerous recreational activities, from hiking, biking and following nature trails to swimming, sailing and kayaking.

name: Spike Island
description: Discover Ireland's Captains & Convicts and Sinners and Saints at Spike Island Cork, Ireland's historic island. Voted Europe's Leading Tourist Attraction of 2017! The Island is located off the coast of Cobh in Cork harbour & has over 1300 years of Irish history. From an island monastery & fortress to the world's largest prison in the 1850's and centuries of island homes. Your journey starts with a ferry ride before Ireland's best storytellers take you on a guided tour of the outer island and fortress. You can then self explore our prison cells, fortress, beautiful island walks and also use our on-site cafe. Attractions include the 1850's punishment block, the 1980's prison cells and riot exhibition, Ireland's largest artillery gun park and several penal, military and social history museums. With activities for children and families and guided and self-guided tours, Spike Island has something for everyone. Audio guides available, cafe and gift shop on site.

name: Cockatoo Island
description: Discover a different side to Sydney with a trip to Cockatoo Island / Wareamah. Located in the heart of Sydney Harbour, the island is a source of adventure and inspiration with its award-winning accommodation, panoramic views, guided tours and historic landmarks. A popular attraction is the UNESCO World Heritage listed Convict Site, which provides visitors with a window into the era when Cockatoo Island was a convict gaol (1839-69). Buildings that survived from this turbulent period were constructed by convicts, using blocks quarried from the island’s sandstone. Other highlights include a waterfront campground, licensed cafés, heritage houses and apartments, picnic spots, live music events and a former dockyard that contributed significantly to the nation’s shipbuilding activities between 1857 and 1991. Known to Sydney’s First Nations Peoples as Wareamah, Cockatoo Island is just a short ferry ride from Sydney’s CBD. So, what are you waiting for… escape to Cockatoo Island for a

name: Castle Island

name: Surfers Pro Surf School - Jeju
description: Surfers surf school is based on Jungmun beach, Jeju island. Definitely one of best surf spot in South Korea. Learn to surf during a 2-hour surfing lesson and 2-hour free surfing session on the Jungmun beach. Your expert instructor covers all the basics, catching waves, getting up on the board, and understanding ocean safety and surfing etiquette. Practice in waist-deep water with waves that are ideal for beginning surfers, and soft surfboards that make it easier to get comfortable on the water.

name: Balmoral Island
description: Private beach destination where the encounter with mother nature is a most. Enjoy, relax and let us pamper you with our hospitality. Balmoral Island offers a unique dolphin and stingray program, beach day, activities to do and food & beverage facilities.

name: Gilligan's Island
description: This small mangrove island off the coast of Puerto Rico is home to beautiful undisturbed nature and calm waters. Here, you can swim or snorkel in crystal-clear waters where you'll be able to see schools of tropical fish swimming around. Rent a kayak to explore the intricate canals and surrounding islands while enjoying the tranquil ocean views which stretch for miles. There is also a picnic area on the north side of the island. You can join an all-inclusive boat tour and spend the day exploring both the land and sea with the experience of a trained guide. – Tripadvisor

name: Roosevelt Island
description: An oasis of peace amid Manhattan’s hustle and bustle, Roosevelt Island offers great views of the New York City skyline and the East River. Stroll along the riverfront promenade from the 14-acre Franklin D. Roosevelt Four Freedoms Park in the south all the way up to the northern tip, where you can relax on the grass outside the Roosevelt Island Lighthouse. If you’re hungry, stop by one of the cafes, delis, and restaurants along Main Street. You can ride the subway to Roosevelt Island, but the tramway runs frequently and offers scenic views along the way. – Tripadvisor

name: Erunnaln

name: Turtle Island
description: Welcome to Turtle Island, a 500-acre private island retreat located in Fiji’s Yasawa Islands. Turtle Island offers a sustainable and authentic experience that celebrates the Fijian way of life. We welcome just 14 couples at a time to enjoy this serene experience where each couple can have their own private beach and is assigned a dedicated personal concierge, your Bure Mama. The island is powered by solar energy, produce is all locally grown in the 5acre vegetable garden, and the spacious villas are handcrafted by local Fijian artisans. Your private island includes private beach picnics, unique dining experiences, Fijian inspired spa treatments, horseback riding, scuba diving, champagne sunrise breakfasts, and an amazing and friendly Fijian staff ready to make all of your dreams come true. Through its tranquility, simplicity, and intimacy, Turtle Island serves as an idyllic sanctuary for travelers seeking connection, community, culture, and consciousness.

name: Nami Island
description: No matter the season, Nami Island is a beautiful destination to visit all year round. Known for appearing in many Korean dramas, the island has numerous lanes lined with pine trees, gingko trees, redwood giants and more. Take a scenic walk along the wooden riverside path and snap a photo with the Winter Sonata statue in Gongsaengwon Garden. You can get to the island via ferry or one of the longest ziplines in Korea. Alternatively, join a popular day trip from Seoul which includes Nami Island, Petite France and Garden of Morning Calm. Some tours include attractions like Mount Seorak or Gangchon Rail Bike as well.

description: This artificial island is a favorite with locals for picnicking, playing frisbee, or simply hanging out. Magic Island hosts many popular events and festivals throughout the year, including a spectacular fireworks display every Fourth of July. Ala Moana Beach offers excellent swimming and surfing conditions, with Magic Island lagoon boasting virtually waveless waters. Stay until sunset and be rewarded with orange and red hues bathing over Waikiki and Diamond Head in the distance. Magic Island is actually a peninsula and is easily accessible by both bus and car, although parking can be challenging from mid-morning onwards. – Tripadvisor

name: Jejulan B&B
description: Jejulan B&B? Located on Jeju's most beautiful coastline (Aewol), Jejulan B&B offers stunning sea views in every room and instant access to the walking, cycling and driving routes on Jeju's famous Olle trail route (#16) - only 20mins away from the airport! All guests are welcome to use our cozy community space in the basement where breakfast is also served. There is also a small private garden if you fancy a change of scenery! We are always happy to answer any questions you might have while you're staying with us and exploring Jeju. I speak English and a bit of Chinese and Japanese if it's of any help. Aewol boasts one of the most beautiful coastlines of not just Jeju but Korea. Still very much underexplored by tourists, you can look forward to peaceful strolls and bike rides along the sea. There are plenty of restaurants,coffee shops and several 24 hour local convenience shops in walking distance to Jejulan. We're conveniently located on the coastal route, around 20 minutes away by car from Jeju International Airport. There's plenty of affordable local taxi companies and a bus (#702) that stops close to the B&B. If you're planning to travel by car, please let us know in advance and we can arrange for you to park on-site or direct you to some local free parking spaces. The room 103,202,203 can only accommodate 2 adults respectively. ( room 201:3, room[101+102]:4 ). If you're travelling with children (5yrs+) we may be able to provide you with a futon for an additional charge but please get in touch as soon as possible to confirm. Please note that bringing pets, cooking or smoking is not allowed on the premises, for the sake of other guests.

name: For Ahn Pension
description:
Welcome to For Ahn Pension, your Jeju “home away from home.” For Ahn Pension aims to make your visit as relaxing and enjoyable as possible, which is why so many guests continue to come back year after year.
Free wifi is offered to guests, and rooms at For Ahn Pension offer a flat screen TV, a refrigerator, and a kitchenette.
During your stay, take advantage of some of the amenities offered, including a concierge, a convenience store, and a coffee shop. Guests of For Ahn Pension are also welcome to enjoy breakfast, located on site. For travelers arriving by car, parking is available.
While in Jeju, you may want to check out some of the restaurants that are a short walk away from For Ahn Pension, including Donato's (0.7 mi), And Yu Cafe (0.4 mi), and Samil Sikdang (1.0 mi).
Looking to explore? Then look no further than Hallim Park (1.0 mi), which is a popular Jeju attraction – and it is conveniently located within walking distance of the pension (b&b).
For Ahn Pension puts the best of Jeju at your fingertips, making your stay both relaxing and enjoyable.

name: Nonjitmul Beach House
description:
Looking for a place to stay in Seogwipo? Then look no further than Nonjitmul Beach House, a family-friendly pension (b&b) that brings the best of Seogwipo to your doorstep.
Free wifi is offered to guests, and rooms at Nonjitmul Beach House offer air conditioning, a refrigerator, and a kitchenette.
During your stay, take advantage of some of the amenities offered, including a concierge and express check-in and check-out. Guests of Nonjitmul Beach House are also welcome to enjoy a pool and barbeque facilities, located on site. For travelers arriving by car, free parking is available.
Close to Daepo Haean Jusangjeolli Cliff (2.2 mi), a popular Seogwipo landmark, Nonjitmul Beach House is a great destination for tourists.
When you’re feeling hungry, be sure to check out Childonga, Vadada, and Duke Surf Bistro, which are some Asian restaurants that are popular with locals and out-of-towners alike.
If you’re looking for something to do, Bonte Museum is a nice way to spend some time.
We’re sure you’ll enjoy your stay at Nonjitmul Beach House as you experience everything Seogwipo has to offer.

name: Jeju Seoul Tourist Hotel
description:
Finding an ideal family-friendly hotel in Jeju does not have to be difficult. Welcome to Jeju Seoul Tourist Hotel, a nice option for travelers like you.
For those interested in checking out Gwandeokjeong Pavilion (0.3 mi) while visiting Jeju, Jeju Seoul Tourist Hotel is a short distance away.
Free wifi is offered to guests, and rooms at Jeju Seoul Tourist Hotel offer a minibar, a refrigerator, and air conditioning.
During your stay, take advantage of some of the amenities offered, including a 24 hour front desk, room service, and express check-in and check-out. Guests of Jeju Seoul Tourist Hotel are also welcome to enjoy a fitness center and breakfast, located on site. For travelers arriving by car, free parking is available.
If you like cafes, Jeju Seoul Tourist Hotel is conveniently located near Antoinette, A Factory Cafe, and Titicaca.
If you’re looking for things to do, you can check out Black Pork Street (0.2 mi), Yongduam Rock (0.7 mi), or Jeju Folklore & Natural Museum (0.8 mi), which are popular attractions amongst tourists, and they are all within walking distance.
Jeju Seoul Tourist Hotel looks forward to welcoming you on your visit to Jeju.

name: Thousand Islands
description: Located along the border between northern New York and southeastern Ontario, Thousand Islands is a group of over 1,800 islands. It's home to picturesque archipelagos, world-class wineries, and stunning scenery. You can camp under the stars, book a cozy motel, a beautiful riverside villa, or a full-service hotel to stay the night—there's something for everyone. Don't miss visiting the 120-room Boldt Castle on Heart Island. You might also want to hop on a narrated boat tour that departs from several communities along each border, taking you between islands and past castles and historic lighthouses. – Tripadvisor

description: As Dubai's relaxed and legendary all you can eat taste adventure, Spice Island is a must do dining experience. Discover over 200 dishes created at interactive live cooking corners that follow the spice trail across Asia and the rest of the world. Though Saturday brunch is a particular favorite, our all you can eat lunch and dinner buffet is available every day. The welcoming ambiance and semi private dining areas make this renowned foodie destination ideal for celebrations and group bookings.

description: An expansive 1,500 acre island resort – encompassing a scenic, challenging, and award-winning 18-hole golf course, the Margaritaville family water park, Game Changer entertainment center, marinas, an RV park, hotel and cabin rentals, meeting facilities, and more! Lanier Islands is the perfect escape from Atlanta!

name: City Island
description: Island off the east coast of the Bronx that transforms into a seaside resort on weekends during the summer.

name: Penguin Island
description: Located in the spectacular Shoalwater Islands Marine Park, just 45 minutes south of Perth is Penguin Island- a beautiful, unspoilt nature reserve home to WA's largest colony of little penguin as well as dolphins, sea lions, stingrays, pelicans, ospreys and more. It's also fantastic for swimming, snorkelling, having a picnic or just enjoying some of the best coastal scenery in Perth. Rockingham Wild Encounters operate an hourly ferry service to Penguin Island (it's only a 5 minute ride), glass bottom boat cruises of Shoalwater Bay and adventure style cruises to watch the local dolphins and explore more of the marine park. Sea Kayak Tours and Kite boarding Lessons are also available.

name: Eden Island Hurghada
description: Experience unforgettable moments on one of Hurghada's top beaches, Eden Island being the perfect destination for an unforgettable holiday. The nature and luxury of the island are specially designed for your comfort. The beauty of nature blends perfectly with the range of services offered on the beach by the top restaurants and bars. Eden Island is the perfect place to relax for couples, but also for families looking for fun. – DAY SCHEDULE: Our boats depart at 9:00 a.m. & return at 15:30 sailing to Marina kindly ensure that you are at our marina no later than 30 minutes before the departure time. -PRIVATE BOATS: If you sail directly to Eden Island with your private boat, please make the booking with the reservation line. – DEPARTURE LOCATION: Our fleet of boats depart/return every day from our Eden Island and Beach, Hurghada – GENERAL RULES: -Pets are not allowed -It is not allowed to bring along any food & beverage -Speakers are not allowed

name: Curieuse Island
description: This island is strictly protected to allow Giant tortoises to prosper.

name: Lopud Island
description: The atmosphere on Lopud Island is peaceful and relaxing, in part due to absence of cars on the island. Grab yourself a buggy taxi to the Sunj sand beach, or opt for a scenic half an hour walk. Relax in a hammock sipping on a cocktail, before checking out the restaurants, bakeries, and souvenir shops along the promenade. Lopud Island is often visited as part of a three-island tour, or as a day trip via ferry from Dubrovnik. For the best weather, time your visit between June and September. – Tripadvisor

name: Holbox Island
description: This island is one of Mexico’s best-kept secrets, known for its car-free roads, pristine beaches, and crystal-clear waters. Other than relaxing on the beach, you can snorkel with whale sharks, go kitesurfing, and kayak through mangroves. Stay till nightfall to experience the magical bioluminescent waters—best experienced on nights of a new moon during summer. Holbox Island is a great day trip destination from Cancun, Riviera Maya, or Playa Del Carmen—many full-day tours include boat tours on the island, on top of ferry transport and meals. Going on the Three Islands tour of Yalahua Lagoon, Isla Pajaros, and Passion Island is also great to see unique wildlife and nature. – Tripadvisor

name: St. Simons Island
description: As the largest barrier island in the Golden Isles, St. Simons Island offers a unique landscape that creates the perfect backdrop for challenging golf courses, friendly inns, and luxurious resorts. Complete with a variety of charming shops and must-visit restaurants, it’s no wonder St. Simons Island earned Southern Living’s Best Vacation Spot in Every Southern State and TripAdvisor’s 17 Beautiful Small Towns to Visit.

name: Jeju Share House
hotelClassAttribution: This property is classified according to Giata.

name: Club Med Bintan Island
description: The Island of Bintan to the south of Singapore is full of history, marked by fallen empires. Its tranquil bays were long used by the Orang Laut pirates as a refuge. This is where Club Med Bintan Island, a haven of tranquility and refinement combining modernity with Asian tradition, now nestles. From the terrace of the Bar, feast your eyes on the mass of lapis-lazuli blue, mother of pearl and emerald, from the pool to the lush gardens. Nearby, Ria Bintan Golf Course is also a golfer's heaven.

Riu Palace is the most elegant category in the RIU hotel chain, with hotels that meet the highest standards in terms of luxury, excellence and sophistication, creating a unique experience. The location is ideal due to its proximity to Downtown Nassau (3.3 km) and Lynden Pindling International Airport (NAS) (20 km) and invites you to explore the area. The hotel has 379 comfortably furnished rooms with free WiFi and offers many amenities. Relax in our spa or get in shape at the gym. 1 outdoor pool and 1 infinity pool with swim up bar. Daytime and evening entertainment, beach volleyball court and group fitness activities. For lovers of gastronomy, live cooking stations and themed buffets at our main restaurant, as well as Japanese, Fusion and Steakhouse specialty restaurants; 3 bars, jerk station and pâtisserie & ice cream parlor.

description:
Finding an ideal hotel in Seogwipo does not have to be difficult. Welcome to Casa de Vivaldi, a nice option for travelers like you.
Given the close proximity to Sanbanggulsa Temple (1.3 mi), guests of Casa de Vivaldi can easily experience one of Seogwipo's most popular landmarks.

name: Malolo Island Resort
description: Malolo is an intimate, rustic resort built in the character of Fiji's Colonial past with grand designs interspersed amongst South Pacific beach cottage style. It's about a bure near the beach, amidst the world's friendliest people with a living and authentic culture. You will be surrounded by the descendants of villagers who made Malolo their home hundreds of years ago, offering true Fijian hospitality. Perfect for families and couples alike, at Malolo, you can fill your day with a myriad of activities or simply unwind and do nothing at all. 100% owned by a local Fijian family, Malolo is all about reconnecting with family and friends without the distractions of "mod-cons". Just the sounds of the coconut trees swaying and the ocean lapping the shore, under the bluest of skies by day and a blanket of stars by night. We believe, Malolo is the way the world should be.

name: COMO Cocoa Island
description: COMO Cocoa Island has reopened on the 9th of January 2020 following a seven-month refurbishment. COMO Cocoa Island is home to 33-overwater villas inspired by local Dhoni boats, the accommodations have been recast top-to-bottom with clean-lined contemporary interiors created by Singapore-based Lekker Architects. The resort also gained an open-sided Pilates and yoga studio, which sits in an elevated position above the lagoon offering 360-degree views. A thrid of the private Island is occupied by the COMO Shambhala Retreat, the island's wellness centre, which offers Asian-based wellness therapies, nutritional advise and exercise in the resort's state-of-the-art new gym. A highlight is the hydrotherapy pool with high-pressure jets used for water-based treatments. COMO Cocoa Island is also providing activities to complement the holistic wellness offering, such as a PADI-certificate dive centre, reef diving, wreck diving, UV night snorkeling and whale shark expeditions.

name: Centara Grand Island Resort & Spa Maldives
description: Surrounded by the blue ocean of the South Ari Atoll, and distinctive with its timbered walkways and colonial-style buildings, Centara Grand Island Resort & Spa Maldives is a barefoot paradise with a palm-fringed beach and shimmering lagoon that offers the perfect island holiday for everyone. With 112 spacious villas set over-water, and suites blending harmoniously with the natural setting, the island has a wealth of activities and superb facilities that makes this an ideal hideaway for couples and honeymooners, or a fun-filled destination for families. The over-water villas enjoy their own sundeck with steps down to the multihued coral reefs. Special villas for families have bunk beds in a children’s area, and you can also enjoy the option of an overwater villa with plunge pool. Champagne breakfasts are served at Reef Restaurant. Lunches and dinners are to be enjoyed at Azurri Mare Italian Restaurant, Suan Bua Thai restaurant or Reef Restaurant. There are two bars on the island. The island offers activities at the age-specific kids’ clubs, water activities like banana boat and tube rides, water sports, and pool games by the children’s pool. There are exceptional opportunities to discover the exotic life of Maldives underwater, with a house reef that is a kaleidoscope of colour for snorkellers, a shipwreck dive site just off the island, and easy access to some of the most famous dive sites in the world.
